briefTitle: Stroke Hyperglycemia Insulin Network Effort (SHINE) Trial
officialTitle: Stroke Hyperglycemia Insulin Network Effort (SHINE) Trial

interventions.name: IV insulin to maintain target glucose concentration of 80-130 mg/dL
Standard Care control - sliding scale insulin to keep glucose less than 180 mg/dL

arms.label: IV insulin drip with target glucose 80 mg/dL - 130 mg/dL
Sub Q insulin to keep glucose less than 180 mg/dL

summary: The Stroke Hyperglycemia Insulin Network Effort (SHINE) Trial is a multicenter, randomized, controlled clinical trial of 1400 patients that will include approximately 60 enrolling sites. The study hypotheses are that treatment of hyperglycemic acute ischemic stroke patients with targeted glucose concentration (80mg/dL - 130 mg/dL) will be safe and result in improved 3 month outcome after stroke.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Favorable Modified Rankin Scale (Yes/No)

effectByArm.arm: IV Insulin Drip With Target Glucose 80 mg/dL - 130 mg/dL
Sub Q Insulin to Keep Glucose Less Than 180 mg/dL
